marketNews.title: BBNI 5M25: Net Profit -1% YoY
marketNews.content:
Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) recorded a bank-only net profit of 1.6 trillion rupiah in May 2025 (down 7% YoY, up 6% MoM). This result brings the net profit for the first five months of 2025 (5M25) to 8.5 trillion rupiah, down 1% YoY, which is lower than the consensus expectation that projected consolidated net profit for 2025F to grow 4% YoY. On a monthly basis, BBNI's net profit in May 2025 shows a post-outbreak recovery, but the recovery is relatively weaker compared with Bank Mandiri (BMRI) and Bank Central Asia (BBCA). Based on the 5M25 performance, we see an indication of a decline in BBNI's performance in 2Q25 compared with 1Q25, unless there is a significant performance improvement in June 2025 relative to the April-May 2025 level. 

DPK and Credit Slowdown
As of May 2025, BBNI's credit growth is at +7% YoY, slowing from +9% YoY in March 2025 and below the management's consolidated 2025 guidance of +8-10% YoY. We assess that this slowdown occurs alongside tight liquidity, reflected in the third-party funds (DPK) which grew only +1% YoY in May 2025, slower than the +5% YoY growth in March 2025. The loan-to-deposit ratio (LDR) rose again to 94.5%, approaching the management's 2025 guidance ceiling of 95%. Limited credit growth space and tight liquidity caused net interest income (NII) to grow only +3% YoY during 5M25. Non-interest income (Non-II) grew a modest +1% YoY and operating expenses (opex) rose +6% YoY, resulting in pre-provision operating profit (PPOP) being flat year-on-year for 5M25. 

Provision Expense Increase
Provision expense fell -18% MoM but still rose +5% YoY in May 2025, so over 5M25 provision expense increased +2% YoY. We highlight the increase in provision expense in April-May 2025, where the average provision expense reached about 670 billion rupiah per month, higher than the 1Q25 average of about 500 billion rupiah per month. This increase is also reflected in the cost of credit (CoC), which rose from 0.8% in 1Q25 to 0.9% during 5M25 (versus 1% in 5M24), although still below the 2025 guidance range of around 1%. 

Key Takeaway
With a high LDR that is close to the management's target ceiling, we consider liquidity easing to be the main factor to restore growth space for BBNI. The recent rise in provision expense over the last two months will also be a focus in the 2Q25 earnings call. Additionally, we see the potential for further downward revisions of the 2025F net profit consensus after recent cuts of -5% to -11% in the past three to six months. From a valuation perspective, BBNI trades at 0.8x 1-Year Forward P/BV as of Thursday (26/6), nearly touching -1 standard deviation (0.77x) below the five-year historical average. At this level, we view BBNI as offering a minimum 7% dividend yield potential.

marketNews.title: Other Hot News to Know
marketNews.content:
1. The Wall Street Journal reported that U.S. President Donald Trump is considering naming a replacement for Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell in September or October 2025 to weaken Powell's position. Powell's term ends in May 2026. Reuters reported that the main candidates to succeed Powell include former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, former White House Council of Economic Advisers head Kevin Hassett, current Fed Governor Christopher Waller, and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent. Trump said on Wednesday (25/6) that Powell is "very bad" for not cutting rates sharply. Powell told the U.S. Senate that rate policy must be cautious because Trump's tariff plan could raise inflation.
2. The Directorate General of Taxes explained that a planned income tax (PPh) article 22 levy on online merchants through marketplaces aims to strengthen supervision and close the shadow economy, according to Bloomberg Technoz. Director Rosmauli said the plan targets online merchants who have not fulfilled tax obligations due to lack of understanding or reluctance to face complex administrative processes. The regulation designating marketplaces as PPh article 22 collectors is still being finalized internally. Reuters previously reported that the tax rate will be 0.5% of seller sales revenue for sellers with annual turnover between 500 million and 4.8 billion rupiah, and the regulation could be announced as early as next month.
3. Sheikh Abdulaziz Al-Thani, Chairman of Qilaa International Group, said on Thursday (26/6) that the group will make an initial investment of about 2.5 billion USD in a project to build one million affordable housing units in Indonesia, with an immediate plan to construct 50,000 apartment units.
4. Hasinah Jusuf, Head of Legal Department of the Indonesian Life Insurance Association, said that the consolidation of state-owned insurance companies will not affect private insurance business. The statement followed Danantara BPI COO Dony Oskaria's announcement of a consolidation plan for 16 state-owned insurers, including affiliates such as AXA Mandiri, BNI Life, and BRI Life. Dony explained that the current state-owned insurers are small and not competitive enough.
5. Apexindo Pratama Duta (APEX) announced the acquisition of an offshore drilling contract worth 7.4 million USD (approximately 120 billion rupiah) from PT Pertamina Hulu Mahakam for a three-month work period.
6. Victoria Investama (VICO), the controlling shareholder of Bank Victoria International (BVIC), purchased about 390.2 million BVIC shares at 115 rupiah per share on 18 June 2025, totaling roughly 44.9 billion rupiah. After the transaction, VICO's ownership in BVIC increased from 52.01% to 54.13%.

marketNews.title: Breakout and Market Direction Insight
marketNews.content: "Liquidity is important because it becomes the price target." - Prabaniswara

tickerNews.title: PTRO Shares Purchased by PT Kreasi Jasa Persada for 91 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, a subsidiary of Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN) and also the controlling shareholder of Petrosea, bought 91 million PTRO shares at an average price of 2,220 rupiah per share on 24 June 2025. The total transaction value is approximately 202 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada's ownership in PTRO increased from 44.385% to 45.287%.

tickerNews.title: MEDC Announces Acquisition of 24% Stake in PSC Corridor from Repsol
tickerNews.content: Medco Energi Internasional (MEDC) announced that it has signed an agreement with Repsol E&P, S.Ã .r.l. to acquire Fortuna International (Barbados), Inc., which holds an indirect 24% ownership in PSC Corridor. The transaction value is 425 million USD (approximately 6.9 trillion rupiah) and is expected to be completed in 3Q25. PSC Corridor has seven gas production fields and one oil production field, all located on the mainland of South Sumatra. MEDC explained that gas sales from PSC Corridor will be conducted through long-term contracts with high-reputation buyers in Indonesia and Singapore. MEDC CEO Hilmi Panigoro said the acquisition aligns with the company's strategy to own and develop high-quality assets that generate strong cash flow.

tickerNews.title: AADI Sells Approximately 3.68% Stake in CITA to ADMR
tickerNews.content: Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI) announced that it has sold approximately 3.68% of its shareholding in Cita Mineral Investindo (CITA) to the subsidiary Alamtri Minerals Indonesia (ADMR), PT Alamtri Indo Aluminium, for a total value of about 572.8 billion rupiah or 3,934 rupiah per share. AADI explained that the proceeds from the sale will be used to strengthen its financial position, while ADMR stated that the purchase of CITA shares is intended to enhance its investment portfolio.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Purchases Approximately 668.2 Million SCMA Shares
tickerNews.content: Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK), the controlling shareholder of Surya Citra Media (SCMA), announced that it has bought approximately 668.2 million SCMA shares at an average price of about 159.5 rupiah per share during the period 12-25 June 2025. The total transaction value is roughly 106.6 billion rupiah. After the transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 64.02% to 64.92%.

tickerNews.title: INDY Secures Multicurrency Credit Facility of $203 Million and IDR 2.8 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Indika Energy (INDY) signed a multicurrency credit facility worth 203 million USD and 2.8 trillion rupiah with Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), DBS Indonesia, and UOB Indonesia. The facility is intended to fully repay a credit facility of 250 million USD dated 2 March 2023 and to finance the Awak Mas gold mining project managed by the company's subsidiary PT Masmindo Dwi Area.

tickerNews.title: PWON Announces 2024 Dividend Plan of 626 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Pakuwon Jati approved on Wednesday (25/6) a dividend distribution plan for fiscal year 2024 amounting to 626 billion rupiah or 13 rupiah per share. This corresponds to a 30% dividend payout ratio (versus 21% in 2023) and indicates a dividend yield of approximately 3.5% as of Thursday (26/6). The cum-date and payment date have not been announced.

tickerNews.title: ASSA Declares 2024 Final Dividend of 30 Rupiah per Share
tickerNews.content: Adi Sarana Armada (ASSA) will distribute a 2024 fiscal year dividend of approximately 185 billion rupiah, representing a dividend payout ratio of about 76% (versus 71% in 2023). This equals a final dividend of 30 rupiah per share and indicates a final dividend yield of roughly 4.1% as of Thursday (26/6). The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 3 July 2025, with payment on 25 July 2025. Previously, ASSA distributed an interim dividend of 20 rupiah per share in November 2024.
